user_message:
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code. Provide your answer with these fields. - is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false), - scenario: a specific violation scenario. Here is the code of dir_reader: ```c static ssize_t dir_reader (void *cls, uint64_t pos, char *buf, size_t max) { DIR *dir = cls; struct dirent *e; int res; if (max < 512) return 0; (void) pos; /* 'pos' is ignored as function return next one single entry per call. */ do { e = readdir (dir); if (e == NULL) return MHD_CONTENT_READER_END_OF_STREAM; } while (e->d_name[0] == '.'); res = snprintf (buf, max, "%s
", e->d_name, e->d_name); if (0 >= res) return MHD_CONTENT_READER_END_WITH_ERROR; if (max < (size_t) res) return MHD_CONTENT_READER_END_WITH_ERROR; return (ssize_t) res; } ``` Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function dir_reader: #define MHD_CONTENT_READER_END_OF_STREAM ((ssize_t)-1) ... #define MHD_CONTENT_READER_END_WITH_ERROR ((ssize_t)-2) Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze: ```c if (max < 512) return 0; ``` Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
scenario: No violation in the shown code: the branch if (max < 512) return 0; is reachable at runtime depending on the value of max, so there is no unreachable code in this function as shown. (A violation would only occur if, elsewhere in the project, it is statically guaranteed that max is always >= 512, making this branch dead.)
